org.factcenter.qilin.comm

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.comm.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single message. For efficiency, message data is stored in ByteBuffers.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()

      • writeBuf

        public void writeBuf(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)
        Write an entire buffer to the message. Note that the buffer is added to the message, not copied. The buffer should be in a "writeable" state (i.e., as after a "compact" operation).
        Parameters:
        buf -

      • readBuf

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer readBuf()
        Read an entire buffer from the message.
        Returns:
        a buffer containing at least one byte, or null if the queue is empty. The buffer returned is ready to be read from (i.e., no need to call flip()).

      • write

        public int write(Message m,
                 int len)
        Write part of another message. The data is read from the other message. Entire buffers can be moved between messages without being copied if this is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        m - The message from which data should be written
        len - At most this many bytes are read from the message m and written to this message.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually written.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] b,
                  int offs,
                  int len)
        Write part of a byte array.
        Parameters:
        b -
        offs -
        len -
        See Also:
        OutputStream.write(byte[],int,int)

      • write

        public void write(int b)
        Write a single byte.
        Parameters:
        b -
        See Also:
        OutputStream.write(int)

      • skip

        public int skip(int len)
        Skip this many bytes (without actually reading them).
        Parameters:
        len -
        Returns:
        number of bytes actually skipped.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b,
                int offs,
                int len)
        Read from the message into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        b - byte array to read into. If null, read will just skip the bytes.
        offs - offset in the byte array at which writing will start
        len - maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read.
        See Also:
        InputStream.read(byte[], int, int)

      • read

        public int read()
        Read a single byte from the message
        Returns:
        the byte read (or -1 if none are available)
        See Also:
        InputStream.read()

      • getOutputStream

        public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Return a stream to which message contents can be written.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Return a stream from which message contents can be read.

      • length

        public int length()
